abstract_ssm: William Mailly was a leading American socialist. He served as National Secretary of the Socialist Party (1903-05), and edited several socialist publications, notably the New York Evening Call (1908-09). The collection contains Mailly's journalistic writings, including literary efforts and reviews, correspondence, and other materials.
corpname_ssm: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
title_ssm: Socialist Collections in the Tamiment Library, 1872-1956
